Class AppContext

java.lang.Object
application.AppContext
public class AppContext extends Object
Centralized application context for managing the database, routing, and repositories.

This class is responsible for initializing the database connection, managing the session, and providing access to various repositories (e.g., Users, Messages, etc.). It also creates a single PageRouter for navigating between different pages.

Author:
Dhruv
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • AppContext

      private AppContext(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws SQLException
      Private constructor sets up the DB connection, runs migrations, and creates the single PageRouter for the entire app.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The main JavaFX stage that the router will control.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if DB initialization fails

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static AppContext getInstance(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws SQLException
      Returns a singleton instance of AppContext, initialized with a primary stage.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The main JavaFX stage.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of AppContext.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs during initialization.

    • getInstance

      public static AppContext getInstance() throws SQLException
      Returns a singleton instance of AppContext without requiring a primary stage.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of AppContext.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs during initialization.

    • router

      public PageRouter router()
      Returns the single PageRouter for page navigation.
      Returns:
      The PageRouter instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the PageRouter was not initialized.
